number of helpful: 20 of 24 people (83%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Product received for free
												Explore a desolate environment and build the road on the go in this exciting racing gameAlthough you might assume there’s not much left to innovate when it comes to racing games, the truth is that there’s always something one change, not to mention all the things that can be added. Not just that, but genre mixing is quite popular as well, which opens up an even larger palette of possibilities when it comes to gameplay mechanics.Build the road ahead one piece at a timeSkyreach is not your typical racing game, but it’s not exactly a revelation in the genre either. In short, the main idea is that you are free to build the track as you go along, making it more of an exploration game than anything else. Unfortunately, it has a few flaws that make the experience a tad too annoying to be enjoyable, especially if you go in expecting speed and actual driving.To begin with, the action takes place in some kind of great desert, although you are actually racing between floating islands. The fact that there’s no ground means that you have to place each piece of the track as you go, otherwise you fall to your death. If this sounds anticlimactic and slow, it’s because it is. Hence, you’re usually moving along at a snail’s place, partly because it’s difficult to maintain speed and build the track, and partly because the game takes forever to place the said track pieces anyway.Over-sensitive controls and decent graphicsYou also have to deal with the poorly optimized controls, given the fact that the vehicle oversteers at the slightest touch, making it incredibly frustrating to negotiate corners at slightly higher speeds. Thankfully, at least you can use a controller to have a better grip on the situation, but that only makes it better than with a keyboard, not better in general. It shouldn’t come as a surprise that controls are important in a racing game.Things are much better in the graphics department, and it’s obvious that the designers put some soul into the environments and the game world in general. The desolate landscapes can be quite moody and engaging, even if you’ll barely get the chance to admire them while you build the track. The graphics quality is decent as well, although there are some performance issues that shouldn’t be there.A great concept that needs a lot of workAll things considered, Skyreach is certainly something new, and it’s only natural that it didn’t come out perfect the first time around. However, something has to change as quickly as possible, because right now the game is not able to keep players happy for more than a few minutes.With out a few updates this game is unplayable. As of now i cannot recommend the game in its current state at all. If you want a racing game look elsewhere cause you wont find it in Skyreach.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												An awful experience.  A dreadfully awful experience.Is this game free?  Yes.Does this game have achievements?  Yes.Are all the negative reviews accurate?  Yes.Does this game have awful framerate on most machines?  Yes.Does this game require you to manually edit the game\'s registry just so it can run smoothly?  Yes.Is this fix temporary to where it will still lag?  Yes.Are the controls over sensitive?  Yes.Is this a racing game with a narrow road?  Yes.Will the music get annoying?  Yes.Is the environment an uninspired and frustrating wasteland? Yes.Should you avoid this game?  Yes.Is this game Skyreach?  Yes.Hope this answers all your concerns...by the way, you only have 3 levels, but get an achievement for "All stages complete" for beating the first two.  Do you really want an easy 100%?  Hope you're up to digging into your registry.  This is obviously a student project that is meant to attempt being innovative, yet p*ss off its own players.0.5/10  Skyreach?  More like Rectalreach.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2016
"Build your roads interactively during you race them"Quite a nice game concept for a little indie F2P game. It's challenging and mean. No way of map planning before you play. Just trial and error. Sometimes I think the clunky controls are intended and you die of falling rocks and columns, crashing into walls and steering into the abyss too easy. You are in somekind of ancient gods cloudworld and try to race with a futuristic vehicle throught many obstacles over buildup roads by your own. Collect the gemsacks to gain a few seconds time back to finally reach the goal. The graphics are ugly and truely not adjustable. The Unity 3D engine is laggy as hell if you aren't using a super gaming PC. Nice adventure soundtrack. Might be nervy over time. But really challenging. Indeed.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Ok, not the type of game I would normally play - but its a nice change of pace. It reminds me of the old game "Pitfall" mixed with "Mario Kart" - only its just you a blank canvas and a race against the clock.  Its worth a play if you enjoy casual games with a race against the clock element. The game in its current state has you driving your ancient bone car thingy and summoning your own path from point A (start) to point B (finish) however, you are able choose how you get from A to B via a simple selection of path summons Left turn, Straight, and Right Turn. There are green crystals that you must collect along the way to increase your time left alive by +5 seconds - from there its simply a creative race against the clock to get from start to finish. All in all its not my cup of tea but I thougth I would try it out since its new, FTP, and no reviews are currently given. I cant say that there was anything about the game I really didnt like, but as I already stated its not my cup of tea so I think if you have 10-15 mins your bored and doing nothing give it a play though - you may just very well love this game.

												Skyreach is a free game that you are racing against the clock in a bone buggy while building the road and seeing the path to the endpoint.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played badly, sounded ok.  Interesting concept but Needs a lot more work.  It works with keyboard.  CONS:- Laggy on all visual qualities.  - It said it works using a xbox 360 controller but it didn't work with my xbox controller, i tried other controller, didn't work.- Keyboard works but there are no instructions for keyboard.  - Game is too hard to play at level 1.  - Hard to do three different things at the same time, Driving at speed, seeing the path to take, and making the path.- There is ONLY 3 levels.- Level 2 is extremely hard with the absence of path guide.- You will have to restart many times to figure out the path and the order of path building.Try it and delete it.For more info:

			A FANTASTIC premise for a racing game. You build the track s you go. In practice you have none of intensity of racing combined with none of the satisfaction of building a track.		

 Ok, not the type of game I would normally play - but its a nice change of pace. It reminds me of the old game "Pitfall" mixed with "Mario Kart" - only its just you a blank canvas and a race against the clock. Its worth a play if you enjoy casual games with a race against the clock element. The game in its current state has you driving your ancient bone car thingy and summoning your own path from point A (start) to point B (finish) however, you are able choose how you get from A to B via a simple selection of path summons Left turn, Straight, and Right Turn. There are green crystals that you must collect along the way to increase your time left alive by +5 seconds - from there its simply a creative race against the clock to get from start to finish. All in all its not my cup of tea but I thougth I would try it out since its new, FTP, and no reviews are currently given. I cant say that there was anything about the game I really didnt like, but as I already stated its not my cup of tea so I think if you have 10-15 mins your bored and doing nothing give it a play though - you may just very well love this game. Ancient times meets the trackmania and some crystalls. There are only 3 levels and i finished it under 30 minutes (i was downloading an other game lol)So its great to pass the time. Keep in mind its free, and its made by some graduets for their project.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
WARNING: This is not a racing game at all! Don't come into this expecting racing gameplay-like features.What this game is: You drive around a scene, trying to collect green crystals that give you the time needed to reach the end of the scene. But the path you drive on is created by you, section by section, as you go (you choose between a left turn, a right turn, and a straight ahead path). It's like an "exploratory race against time", except you're only racing against the clock.It feels and plays like an early stage indie game. There are some good ideas for a game here, and I did enjoy it, even if it was not a great overall experience. That said, the game is free, so I think everyone should give it a go.PROS Free Refreshing concept Nice art-styleCONS Very short (3 stages only) Awkward controls

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
												You could call this "game" is a puzzle racer.  Not a combo you see much of...and now we know why.   YES: Original car design Original game concept Free  NO: Bad/slow controls Bland level design Bad overview/ perspective    Conclusion: I could not really call it a game, it felt more like a proof of concept. The game idea is very simple race your "wheely thing", and during the race you build the track you are driving on.  But the timed race and building of the track don’t mix. Sometimes you had no idea where to go, and when you placed the track, more then often it was placed in or against a wall before you noticed it. And so you fell off the track or tried to fix the mistake and would fall off in reverse... Did I mention the track is floating?  The controls felt unresponsive, and every time you think about racing fast, the lane did not keep up or you found yourself head first in to a wall.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
												Interesting concept.  Nice artwork/style.But... quite slow, and not much fun.... but with a lot of potential.  I found myself having to slow down and wait to 'draw' the next track piece.  If my mind is 2 or 3 pieces ahead, I wanted to draw them and drive them quickly, but I couldn't. Dying because I didn't make it to the next gem in time, caused frustration, not the need to replay.   I wanted to keep drawing track and trying to make it to the gem... after a few rounds, then I could trying to find the optimum route... but, nope... don't get it right... game over.I also wanted the ability to build the track up and down, not just left, right, forward.  Just my 2 cents.  At this point, fun to try for free.  Possibly quite a good and interesting driving puzzle game with some work.  For now though, I can't recommend.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
Pros :-Free.-Full controller support (not that I have a working one).-Interesting idea for the game. And I like racing games in genral (not that I play many of them).Cons :-Short.-The soundtrack seems nice at first but after a while your ears start bleeding so save yourself the misery and mute the game before you start playing.-My PC is♥♥♥♥♥♥and even so it has double the minimum required RAM and the processor is better than the required one. Having said that it was still laggy as ♥♥♥♥ and was barely playable.-Sometimes I would press a button to build a road but nothing would happen. Actually something would happen - me dying because a road wasn't build...-There were times when I pressed a button to build a road after my car has been runing in thin air for at least 1 second...-I touched the ground after "falling" from half a meter resulting in my car being in pieces, yet a real fall from 10+ meters didn't break it. It just simply disappeared in thin air. Magic!-"Rainbow Goat" achievement which requires one to collect 50 crystals without dying unlocked after I completed the first level and I died many times while not collecting 50 crystals...-"Sky Reached" achievement requires one to complete all levels which are three, yet in the description when I was at 0 it said 0/2. That's right, it unlocked after completing level two.Conclusion :Avoid at all cost! Only If you want some achievements and an easy 100% game I can recommend it. I've played crappy games but this is in my top 3. Even if it's free I am still requesting a refund. No/10

Posted: April 29, 2016
												Original type of game, that mix Trackmania with puzzle stuff.It's so basic game without anything special, but if you're looking for some 15minutes (literally 15minutes) game, that aren't so common, there you go.Imo it should be a little bit harder and longer, coz it has potential, but it definitely lacks of challenges and amount of levels.+ add car skins, ♥♥♥♥♥es love skins in games ;]

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 30, 2016
												Skyreach is a nice little unity game, that plays and feels like a student game. Unfortunately, its coming from a studio that is supposed to be professional by now. The good original idea ( building the track you race on as you go ) does not make up for  the lack of good feedback,instateneous deaths, poor graphics ( is this really unity on fantastic mode ?) and frustrating level design. This feels like a first playtest in a second year of school. Too bad, since it's an okay concept.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Skyreach,in short, nice concept, not so biljant excution.What is it what I don't like about this game?Well, it's the controls and the presentation. In my opinion the controls are not precise enough and the way things are presented gives me the feeling that it's just some hobby project.Basically, that's okay if it wasn't for the many strange crashes that I get or the absence of any hints if needed.Might be just me, but I'm not a sucker for this kind of game.

content:
Posted: May 15, 2016
Product received for free
												"A game where you build the roads you drive on? cant be that bad!"oh its bad, beleive me its bad.forstarters, no optons menu,literally the options menu was sound ad music sliders. thats itwith that said it runs on the unity engine, an engine the absolutely HATES my computer. averaging out at 2 frames a second with about a 3 second delay on my inputs. id be ok if i could maybe reduce my resolution to be able to REMOTLY PLAY THE GAME. but as i said, the options menu consists of two sliders for volume and sound.and since i never truely got to "play" the game, i cant tell you about gameplay, mostly because i couldnt see the game trough two still images reappearing repeatedly on my monitor before the still of my car exploding on the side of a mountian appears. which is percidely what will happen to my computer if i dont shut the game down before my GPU bursts into flames
